intro: Gustavia dumitiana, commonly known as the Mexican beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking purple berries that appear in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy texture, while its flowers are small and white, often clustered in axillary inflorescences. The berries are not only ornamental but also serve as a food source for various birds and mammals.
